title: Panzanella with Anchovy Dressing
description: A vibrant Tuscan-style bread and tomato salad tossed with a savory anchovy-lemon dressing. Crisp toasted bread soaks up bright ripe tomatoes, red onion, cucumber and basil for a refreshing, rustic summer dish.

ingredients.notes: about 10-11 oz; crusty bread works best

ingredients.display_name: ripe tomatoes (mixed varieties, cut into 1-inch pieces)
ingredients.notes: about 3 medium or 4-5 small vine tomatoes
soak in cold water briefly if very sharp

ingredients.display_name: anchovy fillets in olive oil (finely chopped)

ingredients.notes: about 1 tbsp; optional for briny flavor
adjust to taste; includes seasoning for tomatoes and bread

ingredients.display_name: optional baby arugula or lettuce (roughly chopped)
ingredients.notes: adds peppery green note if desired

steps.text: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Spread the bread cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet, drizzle with a small portion of the olive oil and a pinch of salt, toss to coat, and toast until golden and crisp at the edges.

While bread toasts, prepare the vegetables: cut tomatoes into bite-sized pieces, slice the cucumber, and thinly slice the red onion. Place vegetables in a large mixing bowl and sprinkle with half the salt to draw out some juices.

Make the anchovy dressing by combining finely chopped anchovy fillets, minced garlic, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, and remaining salt in a small bowl; whisk while slowly streaming in the remaining olive oil until emulsified. Stir in rinsed capers if using and season with pepper.

Remove toasted bread from oven and let cool slightly. Add toasted bread cubes and torn basil (and optional greens) to the bowl with tomatoes and cucumber. Pour the anchovy dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine, pressing lightly so bread soaks up juices.

Let the salad rest at room temperature for 5–10 minutes to allow flavors to meld, then taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt, pepper or a splash of vinegar if needed. Serve at room temperature.
